definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: Such a petition, fervently presented, will elevate the spirit of all your devotions .
sentences.chinese: 如此热诚呈献的祷词将提升你挚爱之灵。
这是一个非常简单的祷词。

sentences.english: He disregards your self-satisfied conversation and embraces his self-condemnation.
sentences.chinese: 祂轻看你自满的祷词，却拥抱自责的罪犯。

sentences.english: There are many prayers, religious or not, that can remind you to be grateful.
sentences.chinese: 有许多祷词，宗教与否，都可提醒你要感恩。

sentences.english: The weary priest droned a prayer.
sentences.chinese: 疲惫不堪的牧师喃喃地念祷词。

sentences.english: “If the only prayer you said in your whole life was, ‘thank you, ’ that would suffice.” – Meister Eckhart
sentences.chinese: 如果你一生只会说一句祷词‘谢谢’，足矣。

sentences.english: She says her prayers every evening before she goes to bed.
sentences.chinese: 她每天晚上睡觉前都叨咕一遍祷词。

sentences.english: The people in the church were chanting a prayer.
I brushed my teeth and said prayers and got into bed.
sentences.chinese: 我刷完牙，念了祷词，上床睡觉。

sentences.english: As consideration for the gift, each boy must recite a prayer for Bost's soul.
sentences.chinese: 每人都必需背诵一段祷词，以此告慰波斯特的灵魂。

definition: to read out/to recite/to remember sb (while talking about sth else)
variant of 頌詞|颂词[song4 ci2]
